Uses of Class
org.bitcoinj.protocols.channels.PaymentChannelServerState

  • Packages that use PaymentChannelServerState 
    Package Description
    org.bitcoinj.protocols.channels
    Micropayment channels allow for rapid tiny payments to be made to a third party once a channel has been set up, using some of the advanced features of the Bitcoin protocol.

    • Uses of PaymentChannelServerState in org.bitcoinj.protocols.channels

      Subclasses of PaymentChannelServerState in org.bitcoinj.protocols.channels 
      Modifier and Type Class and Description
      class  PaymentChannelV1ServerState
      Version 1 of the payment channel server state object.
      class  PaymentChannelV2ServerState
      Version 2 of the payment channel state machine - uses CLTV opcode transactions instead of multisig transactions.
      Methods in org.bitcoinj.protocols.channels that return PaymentChannelServerState 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      PaymentChannelServerState StoredServerChannel.getOrCreateState(Wallet wallet, TransactionBroadcaster broadcaster)
      Gets the canonical PaymentChannelServerState object for this channel, either by returning an existing one or by creating a new one.
      PaymentChannelServerState PaymentChannelServer.state()
      Returns the underlying PaymentChannelServerState object that is being manipulated.
      Methods in org.bitcoinj.protocols.channels that return types with arguments of type PaymentChannelServerState 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      com.google.common.util.concurrent.ListenableFuture<PaymentChannelServerState> PaymentChannelServerState.provideContract(Transaction contract)
      Called when the client provides the multi-sig contract.
